Most of the problems with forks are that they are deployed typically by extractors to make profit without having proper understanding of the codebase. Itâ€™s definitely easy to fork Uniswap and it might work perfectly fine but in case of lending protocols, there is set of business logic to understand and mechanics that without understanding properly, might create some substantial losses for their users. It can be as simple as applying wrong type of oracle configuration. If someone would really be interested to fork and provide the best value for their users and best resourcing to succeed, they would simply opt in with friendly fork frameworks.
Same thing happened with countless uniswap v2 forks as well, like Uranium for example ğŸ˜‚
And since all of them are gone now :)
